name: Common Mallow, Dwarf mallow
overview: This plant is often consumed as a food. This is especially true of the seeds, which contain 21% protein and 15.2% fat. The plant is an invasive species in the United States. Blooms through July and September.
habitat: The Common Mallow is not native to california but likes to grow on dry soil, usually in coastal habitats, dry walls. They sometimes appear as a weed in cultivated grounds.
